thread.title: Boeing Union says members reject labor contract, vote to strike | Morningstar
thread.title_full: Boeing Union says members reject labor contract, vote to strike | Morningstar

title: Boeing Union says members reject labor contract, vote to strike | Morningstar
text:
By Sharon Terlep
SEATTLE-Boeing's (BA) biggest labor union overwhelmingly voted to strike, halting production of its best-selling jets and dealing the latest blow to the struggling aerospace giant.
Thousands of machinists that build Boeing's 737, 777 and 767 jets will walk off the job shortly after midnight Friday, after rejecting a labor deal struck between the union's leaders and Boeing's executives. The contract offered 25% wage increases over four years.
Write to Sharon Terlep at sharon.terlep@wsj.com
This content was created by MarketWatch, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. MarketWatch is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.
(END) Dow Jones Newswires
